metadata.title: Alkimia Inc Mexican Handmade Rebozo Shawl
features: Authentic and beautiful rebozo weaved on backstrap looms by artisans in Tlaxcala, Mexico. Made of cotton and acrylic fiber. Warm and soft

Versatile garment, usually folded or wrapped around the head or upper body to shade from the sun, provide warmth and as an accessory to an outfit. Additionally it can be used as blanket, bed throw, yoga mat, tablecloth, etc, adding fantastic color to any room.
Used by Mexican midwives or doulas during labor and then used by mothers to carry their babies. Please notice the quality of the fringe, you won't find it in other rebozos
Nice design with brightly colored patterns as in the pics, however slight variations in hue and pattern may occur
Size: 8 x 2.5 feet / 96” x 30” (each fringe is 9”) / 244 x 76 cms (each fringe is 23 cms)
description: A rebozo is a traditional Mexican cloth which looks like a cross between a scarf and a shawl. Like ponchos, huipils and sarapes they are classic Mexican garments. A rebozo is long enough to wrap around a woman's body and can be used in pregnancy and labour by midwives, doulas and support people as a comfort measure and to encourage babies into an optional position. Because of the nature of the garment, especially the fringes, they should be hand washed. The dye may or may not be colorfast so mild soap should be used
